result.execSummary:
The defendant Joenelle L Sawa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs. Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Sign releases.

No Contact with the Menards in Waukesha, or with Eric H. or any witness listed in the criminal complaint.  Maintain employment and/or school combination. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Straight Time. STAYED - to be used at the agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joenelle L Sawa

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
Dated 08/14/15, received today (Date stamp is 10:41 am, hearing was scheduled for 9:30am), from Atty Bortz to Judge Carter with attached information for sentencing hearing.

Defendant Joenelle L Sawa in court with Attorney William Bortz.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Bortz makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

6 MONTHS STRAIGHT TIME 

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR     **CONCURRENT** 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: Menards in Waukesha or with Eric H. or any witness listed in criminal complaint 

COSTS:  $253.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  60 Days straight time - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion
Sentencing hearing on August 19, 2015 at 09:30 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Joenelle L Sawa in court with Attorney William Bortz.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #2.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #2. Attorney Bortz requests a sentencing date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on July 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joenelle L Sawa in court with Attorney William Bortz.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bortz requests an adjournment as he was just appointed to this case.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 06/01/15.
Hearing on June 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Joenelle L Sawa in court.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states she did not qualify for public defender representation.  Defendant states she will be seeking counsel.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on April 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant to have no contact with co-defendant/witnesses/business listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Balance of cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.

Defendant Joenelle L Sawa in court.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Court advises of right to an attorney.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on March 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Informing defendant that proper paperwork including indigency evaluation must be completed before an attorney can be appointed.
